messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: Investigator Lewis, with the assistance of Chauffer Rodney Robinson, rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag. Technician Muhammad photographed and collected the spent casing, which was identified as a

9mm Luger at 12:31am. Sergeant McMullen advised Detective Morton there was a blood trail from the interior hallway were the victim is located to North Derbignay Street. Detective Morton observed the H-10983-09 PAGE 16 At that point the witness observed her sister unresponsive and bleeding on the floor at the entrance to the bedroom. Detective Aucoin, believing that he had exhausted the scene for night, locked and secured the residence and placed a seal from the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office on the door. Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers, Unit 5137, conducted gunshot residue test on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. Detective David Trehan's Coroner's Office Day Records officially classified the shooting deaths as Homicides. Detective Sergeant Chris Robert, Officer Juan Lopez, Officers Phil Burras & Quincy Broaden, Officers Nate Addison & Glen Hewitt, Detective Gregory Johnson, Detective Jason McGee, Detective Ananie Mitchell, Detective Melvin McCullum, and Detective Pratt of the Homicide Section were all involved in various capacities throughout the investigation. Scientific Criminal Investigations Division Officer Gary Sallienger was tasked with sketching a broken piece of doorjamb into the scene sketch. Orleans Parish Coroner's Office Investigator Parnell Williams processed the scene.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Assisted by Rodney Robinson, he rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Photographed and collected a spent casing identified as a

9mm Luger.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Advised Detective Morton of a blood trail leading from the interior hallway to North Derbignay Street.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective MortonOfficer Context: Was advised of the blood trail by Sergeant McMullen and observed the unresponsive victim.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective AucoinOfficer Context: Secured the residence and placed a seal from the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office on the door after exhausting the scene for the night.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: His Coroner's Office Day Records classified the shooting deaths as Homicides.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Sergeant Chris RobertOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: Detective SergeantOfficer Name: Officer Juan LopezOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Officers Phil Burras & Quincy BroadenOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Officers Nate Addison & Glen HewittOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Detective Gregory JohnsonOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Jason McGeeOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Ananie MitchellOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Melvin McCullumOfficer Context: Mentioned in the context of the investigation.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective PrattOfficer Context: Handled the scene on Mazant Street, as part of the Homicide Section.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Officer Gary SalliengerOfficer Context: Tasked with sketching the broken piece of doorjamb into the scene sketch.Officer Role: Scientific Criminal Investigations Division OfficerOfficer Name: Investigator Parnell WilliamsOfficer Context: Processed the scene on behalf of the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office.Officer Role: Coroner's Office Investigator
